name: Sweeney Swings His Razor Once Again! Quiz | Humanities | 15 Questions

questions.text: What is unique about the actors in the show?
options: Every actor plays one part in the first act and a different one in the second
questions.explanation:
They also play instruments.

	All the actors double as the orchestra. For example, the original Jonas Fogg also played bass, and the original Mrs. Lovett played the tuba, among other instruments.

questions.text: Who originated the role of Judge Turpin in the 2005 revival?
questions.explanation:
Mark Jacoby.

	Michael Cerveris and Alexander Gemignani were members of the original cast, and Edmund Lyndeck played the role in the original production in the 1970's. Mark Jacoby has also appeared in "Ragtime" and "Man of La Mancha".

questions.text: Which cast member has also released his solo debut album?
questions.explanation:
Michael Cerveris.

	Michael Cerveris' "Dog-Eared" hasn't garnered much press coverage, although it's not getting panned either.

questions.text: What is different about the role of Pirelli from previous productions?
questions.correct: The role is played by a woman, and is usually played by a man
options: The role is played by a  man, and is usually played by a woman
Pirelli's occupation is that of a barber. Pirelli was a butcher in previous productions
Pirelli's occupation is that of a butcher, where in previous productions Pirelli was a barber
questions.explanation:
The role is played by a woman, and is usually played by a man.

	Donna Lynne Champlin played the role of Pirelli, the Italian barber. Joaquin Romaguera played the role in the original production.

John Doyle.

	John Doyle has directed over 200 plays in his native England, but "Sweeney Todd" marked his directing debut on Broadway.

questions.text: At which theatre did the revival play?
questions.explanation:
Eugene O'Neil Theatre.

	Other shows that have played at the theatre include "Death of a Salesman", "Grease", and "Nine". It was christened the Eugene O'Neil Theatre in 1959.

questions.text: Not counting the understudies, how many people in the cast made their Broadway debut with the 2005 revival of "Sweeney Todd"?
options: None, each actor has appeared on Broadway before
questions.explanation:
3.

	Lauren Molina, Benjamin Magnusson and Diana DiMarzio are all making their Broadway debuts with the revival production of "Sweeney Todd". Lauren Molina, we're assuming, is no relation to Alfred Molina. Champlin played Honoria Glossop, one of Bertie's would-be suitors. I hope you "Jeeves" fans noticed Hugh Laurie as an incorrect choice; he played Wooster on the  television series that ran from 1990 to 1993.

questions.text: Which cast member was also in "By Jeeves"?
questions.explanation:
Donna Lynne Champlin.

	"By Jeeves" is a musical by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Alan Ayckbourn based on the stories featuring the bumbling Bertie Wooster and his tolerant butler, Jeeves.

questions.text: What is Sweeney's relation to Johanna?
questions.explanation:
He's her father.

	Although neither of them know it, Johanna is the daughter of Sweeney's late wife, Lucy.

questions.text: Which description best fits the reviews the revival received?
questions.explanation:
Very positive.

	With few exceptions, the revival production has garnered acclaim from critics from the "New York Times", "Rolling Stone" and various other sources.

questions.text: Which cast member was nominated for a Tony for his/her role in "Show Boat"?
questions.explanation:
Mark Jacoby.

	Mark Jacoby played Gaylord Ravenal in the production, which also featured John McMartin and Elaine Stritch. Jacoby sang "You Are Love" and "Where is the Mate for Me?".

Fire.

	"City on Fire" is a lengthy song involving all the characters towards the end of the second act.

questions.text: Diana DiMarzio originated the role of the Beggar Woman in the revival production. What instrument did she play?
questions.explanation:
Clarinet only.

	All too late, Sweeney discovers that the Beggar Woman who annoys Londoners with her constant sexual comments is actually his lost love, Lucy.

questions.text: Patti LuPone had previously appeared as Mrs. Lovett prior to the revival.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Patti LuPone debuted as Mrs. Lovett in a 2000 concert that was aired on PBS. This, however, marks her Broadway debut in the role.

questions.text: When appearing as Sweeney in the original production, Len Cariou sported a full head of hair. As Sweeney in the revival, how did Michael Cerveris wear his hair?
options: He kept his hair slicked back
questions.explanation:
He was bald.

	Michael Cerveris sported a shaved head for "Sweeney Todd", quite a departure from Cariou's peculiar hairdo!
